title: Add GitHub Actions for CI/CD testing
description:
## Goal
Create GitHub Actions workflows to run automated tests on every PR and push.

## Requirements

### Basic Test Workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Trigger on: push to main, all PRs
- Jobs:
  - **cargo-check**: Run `cargo check --all-targets`
  - **cargo-test**: Run `cargo test --workspace`
  - **cargo-clippy**: Run `cargo clippy -- -D warnings`
  - **cargo-fmt**: Run `cargo fmt --all -- --check`
- Use rust-cache action for faster builds
- Matrix: Test on ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest

### Optional but Nice:
- Separate workflow for release builds
- Dependency audit workflow (cargo-audit)
- Coverage reporting (tarpaulin or similar)

## Acceptance Criteria
- ✅ Workflow file exists and is valid YAML
- ✅ Runs on PR creation
- ✅ All checks must pass for PR to be mergeable
- ✅ Fast iteration (use caching effectively)
- ✅ Clear failure messages

## Notes
- Start simple: just cargo check and cargo test
- Can expand later with more sophisticated CI
- Consider using actions-rs/toolchain for Rust setup
- Use actions/cache or Swatinem/rust-cache for caching

## Related
- Blocks future PRs from breaking the build
- Should work with the minimal gastown crate once gt-9xv is fixed

title: Fix: Add gastown crate WITHOUT deleting GPUI
description:
## Problem
Nux's commit (943376caf6) deleted ALL Zed crates including crates/gpui/, which we need!

The commit removed:
- crates/gpui/ (WE NEED THIS!)
- crates/ui/ (WE NEED THIS!)
- crates/theme/ (WE NEED THIS!)
- crates/git/ (WE NEED THIS!)
- And many others...

This won't compile because crates/gastown/Cargo.toml references 'gpui.workspace = true' but there's no gpui crate anymore.

## Correct Approach
✅ KEEP: gpui, ui, theme, git, workspace, project, menu, picker, panel
✅ ADD: crates/gastown/ (the new app)
✅ MODIFY: Cargo.toml (add gastown to members, set as default-member)
❌ REMOVE: Only editor-specific crates (editor, lsp, vim, terminal_view, collab, etc.)

## Files to Create
- crates/gastown/Cargo.toml (use workspace deps for gpui)
- crates/gastown/src/main.rs (minimal GPUI app)

## Testing
- Must compile: cargo check -p gastown
- Must run: cargo run -p gastown
- Window shows 'Gas Town' title

## Priority
P0 - Blocks all other work. Main branch is broken.

title: Create comprehensive transformation plan: Zed → Gas Town UI
description:
Develop a detailed plan for transforming the Zed editor into a Gas Town management UI. The plan should cover:

UNDERSTANDING THE TRANSFORMATION:
- Zed is a code editor with GPUI (Rust GPU-accelerated UI framework)
- Gas Town is a multi-agent orchestration system needing visualization

KEY UI REQUIREMENTS:
1. Dashboard view showing Town/Rigs hierarchy
2. Agent status visualization (Mayor, Polecats, Witness, Refinery)
3. Convoy progress tracking and management
4. Hook state visualization (git worktrees, work persistence)
5. Real-time updates of agent activity
6. Configuration management interface
7. Beads/issue tracking integration
8. Mail system visualization

TECHNICAL APPROACH:
1. Which Zed components to keep (GPUI, rendering, state management)
2. Which to remove (editor-specific: buffers, language servers, etc.)
3. New components needed for Gas Town visualization
4. Data model transformations (editor state → agent/convoy state)
5. API integration with Gas Town backend (Go services)

ARCHITECTURE:
- How to structure the new UI codebase
- Data flow between Gas Town (Go) and UI (Rust/GPUI)
- Real-time updates mechanism
- State synchronization strategy

IMPLEMENTATION PHASES:
Break down into logical phases with dependencies

REFERENCE MATERIALS:
- Gas Town README: https://github.com/steveyegge/gastown/blob/main/README.md
- Zed uses GPUI framework with 211 crates
- Gas Town has dashboard mentioned in README (line 362-378)

Deliver a detailed markdown plan document.
